item.title: Work
item.description: Sid Patil is an Android Engineer and Kotlin Advocate. He currently works at Delivery Hero SE in Berlin, Germany. Previously he worked at Paytm and Insider.in on payment related mobile software. He also helped build mobile learning apps for banks like Axis, ICICI and Yes in India.

item.title: Search
item.description: Sid Patil is an Android Engineer and Kotlin Advocate. He works at Delivery Hero SE in Berlin Germany. Search this website for articles on Android, Kotlin, Jetpack Compose and much more.

Currently he helps build food delivery and quick commerce experiences imacting over 50 countries. You will find him organizing events, giving talks and writing articles that help others.

item.title: About
item.description: Sid Patil is an Android Engineer and Kotlin Advocate. He works at Delivery Hero SE in Berlin Germany. Currently he helps build food delivery and quick commerce experiences impacting over 50 countries. You will find him organizing events, giving talks and writing articles that help others.

item.title: Obsidian: My second brain
item.description: Tired of moving between note-taking tools? Keep losing code snippets, TODOs and ideas? Meet Obsidian, a Markdown note taking tool to boost your developer productivity.

item.title: Supporting adaptive themed icons on Android 13
item.description: One of the coolest features of Android 13 with Material You and Monet is dynamically themed icons. Let us take a look at how we can migrate our apps to Tiramisu and add support for custom themed icons to match the system wide dynamic theme colors.

item.title: Chasing Monet inside the Android framework
item.description: We deep dive into the internals of the Android framework, covering the System-UI to understand the changes introduced starting from Android 12/12L and above, code-named Monet. We will explore the new system-wide dynamic theming capabilities and take a look at how Monet fuels the Material You design.

item.title: Dynamic themes with Compose and Material 3
item.description: Use wallpaper generated system colors from Android 12 and Material You to repaint your apps to the users taste by using the material design 3 library and Jetpack compose

item.title: Android Worldwide: January 2022
item.description: We kickstart 2022 at Android Worldwide with a two days session on January 25th & 26th. This quarter we cover different topics ranging from managing memory at multiplatform level with Kotlin, maxing out the performance of your SQLite database, implementing FTS for faster database querying and much more!

item.title: I have joined Delivery Hero!
item.description: Super excited to share that I have joined Delivery Hero and relocated to Berlin, Germany. For the next chapter of my career, I will be helping shape ordering experiences of multiple food delivery and Q-commerce apps.

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Learn backend engineering with Ktor
item.description: Himanshu Singh convinces us why Kotlin is a viable option for backend engineering. Explore popular Kotlin backend frameworks and understand the merits of using Ktor.

item.title: Build function chains using composition in Kotlin
item.description: Leverage Kotlin fold aggregating operators to build function chains with compositional patterns. Learn how you can build a system similar to compose UIs Modifier logic on Android

item.title: Android Worldwide: July 2021
item.description: This quarter we explore simple stacks, Error handling with arrow, new activity results API, mobile devops, better gradle dependencies, shared flows in Kotlin, common code issues with KSP, new Window insets API in Android worldwide July 2021 sessions

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Multiplatform projects and server-driven UI
item.description: Build multiplatform projects with SwitfUI and compose and learn the art of server driven UI on Android with John Oreilly and Adit Lal

item.title: Uncoiling the Coil with Sagar Viradiya
item.description: Choosing an image loading library in 2021 can be a challenge. Sagar Viradiya, GDE for Android tells us why Coil is one of the best image loading libraries.

item.title: Android Worldwide: April 2021
item.description: As the second event of the series unfolds, Julien Salvi, Honey Sonwani, Marton Braun, Karan Dhillon, Mohit Sarveiya, Rikin Marfatia and Wajahat Karim talk about the latest in Android development.

item.title: Holi: A library of colors, gradients and utils for Jetpack Compose
item.description: An open-source library of colors, gradients and utils built using Jetpack Compose for Android. Licenced under MIT and available on Maven central.

Currently he helps build food delivery and quick commerce experiences imacting over 50 countries. You will find him organizing events, giving talks and writing articles that help others.

item.title: Dive into Kotlin/JS with Sebastian Aigner
item.description: Let us talk about how we can use Kotlin to leverage one of the most exciting platforms of the last decade, the browser. We will see what it takes to get started with writing Kotlin JS applications.

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai x Android Worldwide
item.description: Kotlin Mumbai joins communities from around the globe for a worldwide event. Niharika Arora, Himanshu Singh and Shubrajyoti Sen take us through Kotin Flows and Joda Time!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Exploring Future of Android UI With Jetpack Compose
item.description: Compose is a new declarative way of making user interfaces on Android. In this talk Gurupreet shares how one can quickly bootstrap a project with compose.

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Dissecting Coroutines
item.description: Mohit Sarveiya walks us through using coroutines in Kotlin and how they work under the hood. In this talk, we will explore basic to advanced features provided by the coroutines library.

item.title: Hacktoberfest: Speed up your workflows with ZSH and command line aliases!
item.description: Boost your productivity and workflows while working on Android projects through Z-shell and OhMyZsh. We will learn how to escape the GUI and perform daily git actions through custom command-line aliases.

item.title: Build a game with Jetpack Compose and Keep up with scoped storage on Android
item.description: In this talk Wajahat Karim, GDE for Android walks us through the basics of building a game in Jetpack Compose and Carlos Mota of GDG Coimbra teaches us more about Scoped storage.

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Building a better codebase with Lint on Android
item.description: On popular demand, the Lint API was extended to support non-Android Kotlin projects. In this talk Subhrajyoti Sen talks about using lint rules to build better codebases on Android.

item.title: How Kotlin won the language war in Android App Development
item.description: Kotlin has changed the way app developers write apps for Android. In this Times of India article, Siddhesh Patil talks about the state of Kotlin in India.

item.title: VESIT: Building Apps For Android in Kotlin
item.description: Continuing our two-day session on kickstarting your journey to become Android developers, budding computer engineering students learn to build their very first app for Android using Kotlin.

item.title: VESIT: Getting Started With Kotlin
item.description: Comp Science students from VESIT engineering college discover why Kotlin is the next-gen language for modern application development as a part of a two-day session on building android apps in Kotlin.

item.title: Kotlin Hyderabad: Introduction to Kotlin
item.description: At their monthly event, Siddhesh Patil gives a talk on introduction to Kotlin at Kotlin User Group Hyderabad

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Increase Your Product Quality Through Accessibility
item.description: Senior Android Engineer at Meetup, Victoria Gonda talks about accessibility on apps and how to make it better!

item.title: Android 11 Meetup: GDG MAD and Kotlin Mumbai
item.description: GDG MAD and Kotlin Mumbai co-organize an Android 11 meetup with Google!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: TDD using Spek
item.description: Senior Android Engineer at BYJUs, Rivu Chakraborty gives a talk on test driven development using Spek

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Github Actions!
item.description: Nicola Corti from Spotify walks us through Github actions! It is time to roll up your sleeves and make production easier!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Kotlin basics and Flows
item.description: Filip Babic and Akshay Chordiya take us through the world of kotlin!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Dagger and Jetpack Navigation
item.description: With the current situation and lockdowns due to coronavirus, we had to roll up our sleeves and prepare for a fully online meetup.

item.title: Better permissions on Android
item.description: Gracefully handle permission denial on Android permission dialogs and leverage permission rational dialogs to enhance the user experience of your application.
